alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 11:50AM PST until January 03 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches with lesser amounts below 2000 ft. Locally higher snowfall accumulations possible at highest terrain. South winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel may be very hazardous. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will hover around 2500-3500 ft, lowering to around 2000 ft by Monday morning.
info.instruction: Keep an eye on the forecast for updates on the situation. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when travelling. Practice your winter safety rules. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your car in case of emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit https://www.tripcheck.com
